intro: Meriandra strobilifera, commonly known as the sandstone lily, is a rare and striking plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllis family and is characterized by its unique, cone-shaped inflorescence that resembles a pine cone. The plant produces vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, which bloom during the winter months. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapted to conserve water in its harsh environment. Meriandra strobilifera is highly sought after by botanists and horticulturists due to its ecological significance and ornamental value.
